oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A GROSS LONGSHORE TRANSPORT RATE FORMULA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Galvin, Cyril J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: longshore transport
rate formula
transport formula
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gross longshore transport rates for 11 long-term field measurements are predicted reasonably well by the empirical relation, Q=2H2, where Q is longshore transport rate in 100,000 yd3/yr, and H is a mean breaker height in feet. A physical explanation of this empirical relation assumes: (1) most littoral drift is transported in suspension; (2) longshore current velocity is predicted by V-gmTsin28j,; (3) the empirical relation is an equation for conservation of suspended sediment in the longshore current.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 13 (1972): Proceedings of 13th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Vancouver, Canada, 1972.; 47
